intro: Koeleria javorkae, commonly known as the Java koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, blue to purple flowers. Koeleria javorkae is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
